chapter.title: Treasury Services
chapter.para: The Treasury Services menu allows you to process Foreign Exchange (FX) instruments such as Deals, Wires and Transfers, and Certificate of Deposit using . For each type of transaction, provides a module that enables you to initiate, amend, and monitor transactions. These modules provide similar set of functions. You can create, maintain, and submit an FX trade request to the treasury back office; attach and release bank payment instructions; process payments, internal fund transfers, and external fund transfers; and initiate a Certificate of Deposit (CD), attach instructions to the CD, and rollover a CD.

note.para: The availability of the Treasury Services menu and its functions is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. Only those functions that the user is authorised to use will be displayed.

chapter.para: When selected from the toolbar, the Treasury Services menu provides the following modules.

listitem.para: Provides a set of functions to:
initiate and submit FX transactions to the treasury back office for the FX Spot, FX Forward, and FX Window Forward instruments.
process payment split for FX Spot and FX Forward trades; drawdowns for FX Window Forward trades.
add, edit, and release bank payment instructions using the Message to Bank menu.
inquire and generate report for the previously executed FX transactions using the FX Inquiry menu.
set references, set entity, and maintain purged and rejected transactions using the FX Maintenance menu.
Provides a set of functions to process internal fund transfer and external fund transfer (that is, wires) transactions.
Provides a set of functions to create, maintain and submit a Certificate of Deposit.
